clauses.title: Content you post may be edited by the service for any reason
clauses.description: This service can edit any content on the service for whatever the reason and at their sole discretion.
clauses.clause_text: Opera has the right to refuse to post, edit, or deliver User Generated Content.

case.text: Content you post may be edited by the service for any reason

clauses.title: Specific content can be deleted without reason and may be removed without prior notice
clauses.description: This service can delete specific content. Usually they will claim they reserve the right to do it at their sole discretion, which is legalese for saying they won't give a specific reason. If the terms say they will not notify you, it shall be included in the quote but if it does not explicitly say they will give you a notice, it can be reasonably inferred that they can do it without telling you.
clauses.clause_text: Opera reserves the right to remove User Generated Content for any reason

case.text: Specific content can be deleted without reason and may be removed without prior notice

The current version of these Terms are posted at https://www.opera.com/terms. The Privacy Statement is posted at https://www.opera.com/privacy. It is your responsibility to remain informed of any changes, because you are legally obligated to abide by the latest versions of these Terms and the Privacy Statement.

clauses.title: Your profile is combined across various products
clauses.description: When using multiple services from one same company, they can combine these (unrelated) information sources about you to build up a single richer user profile about you.
clauses.clause_text:
Statistical data like this helps us understand what is interesting and relevant to our customers, so we can best adapt our content for our customers’ benefit.

We and our third-party service providers may also automatically collect an IP address or other unique identifier information from the computer, mobile device, technology or other device you use to access this Website.

case.text: Your profile is combined across various products

clauses.title: Third-party cookies are used for statistics
clauses.description: For instance, Google Analytics, rather than self-hosted (first-party) statistics software.
clauses.clause_text: We may also use cookies for the purpose of statistics and measurement of marketing campaigns.

case.text: Third-party cookies are used for statistics

clauses.title: Tracking pixels are used in service-to-user communication
clauses.description: The service tracks the user count or some actions of the user; this is usually used for statistics. For example, emails sent by a service can contain a pixel tag, which is a small, clear image that can tell them whether or not you have opened an email and what your IP address is.
clauses.clause_text: Like many sites, our Website employs cookies, JavaScript tags, pixels and Web beacons (also known as clear GIF technology or "action tags") to speed your navigation of our Website, recognize you and your access privileges, and track usage of our Website.

case.text: Tracking pixels are used in service-to-user communication

clauses.title: Third party cookies are employed, but with opt out instructions
clauses.clause_text:
There are some third party cookies on our websites. For your overview, we list categories below.

  • Category A: Analytics, this is done for the purpose of optimizing our sites.
  • Category B: Marketing campaigns, with purpose to measure the effectivity of these.
  • Category C: Site availability, with the purpose of monitoring to what extent our sites are available.

Our websites may set cookies from the following partners:

  • Bing
  • Facebook Pixel
  • Google Analytics
  • Google Tag Manager
  • Hotjar
  • Outbrain
  • Piano
  • Reddit
  • Taboola
  • TikTok
  • Twitter
  • Vimeo
  • Yahoo
  • Youtube

Remember, you may configure a browser to reject third-party cookies via the settings menu.

case.text: Third party cookies are employed, but with opt out instructions

clauses.title: Do Not Track (DNT) headers are ignored and you are tracked anyway even if you set this header.
clauses.description: Even though the Do Not Track (DNT) header was not implemented perfectly, services should not track users whose browsers send a DNT header.
clauses.clause_text:
For California Residents

Many browsers have a “Do Not Track” feature that allows you to instruct websites that you do not want them to track your online activities. These browser features are not uniform, so we are not currently set up to respond to this feature.

a. Geolocation API: A geolocation service provided by Google LLC. By using the service you accept Google’s Terms of Service available at https://policies.google.com/terms. and

b. WhatsApp: A messaging service provided by WhatsApp, Inc., whose terms of use are available at https://www.whatsapp.com/legal. and

c. Facebook Messenger: A messaging service provided by Facebook, Inc., whose terms of use are available at https://www.facebook.com/legal/terms. and

d. Yandex.Zen: A content aggregation/recommendation service offered by Yandex Services AG and its affiliates. By using the Yandex.Zen service, you accept the Yandex.Zen Terms of Use published at https://yandex.com/legal/zen_termsofuse.
